message_1: A car is traveling at a speed of 60 mph. How long will it take for the car to travel a distance of 200 miles? Use temporal logic to solve the problem.
message_2:
To solve this problem using temporal logic, we can use the formula:

Time = Distance / Speed

In this case, the distance is 200 miles and the speed is 60 mph. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Time = 200 miles / 60 mph

Time = 3.333 hours

So, it will take approximately 3.333 hours for the car to travel a distance of 200 miles at a speed of 60 mph.
